questions.question: The amount of fuel and oil carried on board any helicopter at the commencement of a day VFR flight must be sufficient, to provide for foreseeable delays having been considered, to fly to the destination aerodrome,

answers.1: and thereafter for 45 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.2: then to a specified alternate and thereafter for 45 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.3: and thereafter for 20 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.4: then to a specified alternate and thereafter for 20 minutes at normal cruising speed.

questions.question: The amount of fuel carried on board any propeller-driven aeroplane at the commencement of a day VFR flight must be sufficient, having regard to the meteorological conditions and foreseeable delays that are expected in flight, to fly to the destination aerodrome

answers.1: and then fly for a period of 45 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.2: and then fly for a period of 30 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.3: then to a specified alternate aerodrome and then for a period of 45 minutes at normal cruising speed.
answers.4: then to a specified alternate aerodrome and then fly for a period of 30 minutes at normal cruising speed.

questions.question: If a flight plan is not filed, a flight itinerary must be filed

answers.1: for flights proceeding 25 NM or more from the point of origin.
answers.2: only for flights in sparsely settled areas.
answers.3: for flights destined to land at aerodromes or places other than the point of origin.

references: CARs 602.73 - Requirement to File a Flight Plan or a Flight Itinerary
TC AIM-RAC - Flight Plans and Flight Itineraries, When Required

questions.question: After landing from a VFR flight for which a flight plan has been filed, the pilot shall report the arrival to the appropriate ATS unit within
references: CARs 602.77 - Requirement to file an Arrival Report
TC AIM-RAC - Closing a Flight Plan

questions.question: When there is a deviation from a VFR flight plan, ATC shall be notified of such deviation
references: CARs 602.76 - Changes in a Flight Plan
TC AIM-RAC - Changes to the Information in a Flight Plan or Flight Itinerary

questions.question: Where no search and rescue initiation time is specified in a flight itinerary, when shall the pilot report to the “responsible person”?

answers.1: Within one hour after the expiration of the estimated duration of the flight specified in the flight itinerary.
answers.3: Within 24 hours after the expiration of the estimated duration of the flight specified in the flight itinerary.
answers.4: As soon as practicable after landing but no later than 24 hours after the last reported ETA.

references: CARs 602.77 - Requirement to file an Arrival Report
TC AIM-RAC - Closing a Flight Plan

questions.question: With regard to a flight itinerary, the “responsible person” means an individual who

answers.1: has agreed to report the aircraft overdue.
answers.2: is 18 years of age or over.
answers.4: has agreed to report the arrival of the aircraft.

references: CARs 602.70 - Flight Preparation, Flight Plans and Flight Itineraries, Interpretation, TC AIM-RAC - Filing

questions.question: Where a VFR flight plan has been filed, an arrival report must be filed by the pilot

answers.2: at each intermediate stop and then reopened on take-off.
answers.3: by parking the aircraft in close proximity to the tower.
answers.4: except at airports served by a control tower in which case the controller will automatically file the arrival report.

references: CARs 602.77 - Requirement to file an Arrival Report
TC AIM-RAC - Closing a Flight Plan

questions.question:
Estimated elapsed time A to B --------- 1 hour 15 minutes.
Estimated stopover time at B --------- 30 minutes.
Estimated elapsed time B to C --------- 1 hour 20 minutes.

Using the above information, what time should be entered in the “Elapsed Time” box of a VFR flight plan?
When filing a VFR flight plan with an intermediate stop, the total elapsed time to be entered is the total

answers.1: elapsed time for all legs including the duration of the intermediate stop.
answers.2: elapsed time for all legs, plus the intermediate stop, plus 45 minutes.
answers.4: elapsed time to the first landing plus intermediate stops.

questions.question: How is an intermediate stop indicated on the flight plan form for a VFR flight?

answers.1: By including duration of the intermediate stop in 'Elapsed Time' box as ATC automatically checks time between points.
answers.2: Same as any VFR flight plan if the intermediate time does not exceed 30 minutes at each point.
answers.3: By repeating the name of intermediate stop and its duration in the 'Route' column.
answers.4: By simply indicating “Intermediate Stop” in “Other Information” column.
